title: 'The public want Brexit for Christmas' - Telegraph readers on this week's top stories
text:
Boris Johnson challenged Jeremy Corbyn to "end this nightmare" by agreeing to a general election on December 12, this week. The Prime Minister said that he would reintroduce his Brexit Bill and give Parliament until November 6 to pass it if MPs agreed to a pre-Christmas election.

However, Labour appeared to be in a state of confusion after party leader Jeremy Corbyn refused to commit to a snap poll until Brussels revealed the length and terms of a possible Brexit extension.
